Page.text: Spiders create thread which can be used to manufacture
items, or sold to other players.

Page.name: Panda
Page.text: Panda Bears have lots of meat and bones, which can be

Page.name: Hawk
Page.text: These delicate looking birds are deceptively
strong. They are hunted for their feathers.
You can use Hawk Feathers to manufacture:

Page.name: Falcon
Page.text: These delicate looking birds are deceptively
strong. They are hunted for their feathers.
You can use Falcon Feathers to manufacture:

Page.name: Lion
Page.text: A fierce creature, living mainly in jungle areas.

Page.name: Penguins
Page.text: Penguins live in cold regions and can be hunted for
meat and bones which are used in potions and summoning.

Page.name: Goblin
Page.text: Male and Female Goblins (May be Armed)
Goblins are ugly, smelly scavengers. They mostly
travel in packs of 5 or 6, but many times they
could also be seen traveling alone. Varying around
5 feet or less in height, they have greenish pock
marked skin, yellowish brown eyes, and wear clothing,
armor and weapons that they pilfered from dead
corpses in graves, an unsuspecting traveler, or each
other. They are usually too stupid to determine if
fighting you is a good or bad thing for them however.

Page.name: Skeleton
Page.text: The Skeletons are the bones of those who died before
the Great War. The gods of evil even reanimated their
bones when all the flesh and blood was gone to use
against the gods of good. Luckily they did not trap
their souls...although it is said in legends that
there are some whose souls are cursed and must follow
the remainder of their former selves for eternity.

Page.name: Gargoyle
Page.text: When King Vermor mysteriously vanished - most people
claim he died (yet a corpse remains to be found) -
his Gargoyles were freed of his control. They now
wander White Stone in the dark of the night,
turning into stone statues during the day. Some
say they are still loyal and wander in search of
their master, who knows if they will ever find him...

Page.name: Phantom_Warrior
Page.text: Much like the skeletons, the Phantom Warriors were
reanimated by the evil deities during the Great War.
Unfortunately, these were the recently fallen in
the war, and are much more powerful for it. With
their bodies mostly intact, they retain most of
the strength and intelligence they had in life,
coupled with their state of semi-death, and servitude

Page.name: Troll
Page.text: Trolls are primitive brutes, with intelligence about
equal to that of a Cyclops. Unfortunately, they lack
the size and strength of their more massive relatives,
though they are still more than a match for most
unwary adventurers. The clubs which they habitually
wield are more than heavy enough to inflict damage,
or death on those who would disturb them.

Page.name: Orc
Page.text: Male and Female Orcs (May Be Armed)
Orcs are quite intelligent, making strong tactics in
battle. They are also very fearsome creatures, as
they are usually bigger in stature than a human,
and getting wounded only makes them want to fight
even harder. They also don't fear much for their
lives, and will have fights to the death.
Standing at around 6-8 feet tall, they have greenish blue-
brown skin, and wear their own unique armor and clothing,
usually finding those from other races to be inferior to

Page.name: Ogre
Page.text: Ogres tend to live by themselves, and set their own
territories usually quite far from other ogres. They
throw out any other humanoid creature they find
living there and will attack you on site. They are
not as intelligent as the Orcs, and are very grouchy
and lazy. Their skin tones vary from a greenish
color to a human's peach tone, and they're usually
a hulking 8 feet tall with a wide girth (due to

Page.name: Cyclops
Page.text: Cyclops are big strong brutes that will attack
anything moving in site when they feel threatened.
With their obvious lack of brains, they make up for
in strength and size. Not much is known about their
societies because no one has gotten close enough, or
lasted long enough, to tell the tale.

Page.name: Fluffy
Page.text: --The last words of many unwary heros
These should be approached only by the strongest.

Page.name: Chimera
Page.text: A large, powerful, ugly wolf, lacking any majesty. They
are reputed to have been created in a magical accident of
some type. In any case, only the strongest can defeat

Page.name: Hobgob
Page.text: This creature came into being when Unolas was trying to
magically modify a goblin to create a smarter, more
civil variation. The experiment backfired and created a
stronger, and what appears to be a less-intelligent race
They have a blueish skin tone, and a face which

Page.name: Yeti
Page.text: These creatures are very dim-witted and extremely
dangerous. Their bodies are covered in a thick white
fur which protects them from the cold and standing
8-10 feet in height they are an intimidating sight.
Yetis are strong violent creatures who tend to live
alone in dark caves, venturing to the outside world
when in search of food. Many a strong warrior has

Page.name: Giant
Page.text: These gigantic creatures are very aggressive, strong,
and deadly even for the strongest warrior when in a
group, so we are grateful that they tend to be solitary
Although they look very much like humans, the giants do
not have the brain of a human, they are stupid....

Page.name: Feros
Page.text: This large creature resembles a feline, although it
walks upright on two legs instead of all 4, looking
like a cross between a large cat and a human.
The Feros is an aggressive creature and well trained
in combat. Its instincts, superior intelligence, and
cat-like reflexes make it a formidable foe.

Page.name: Cockatrice
Page.text: This large rooster like monster has the tail of a
lizard and the wings of a dragon. Legend tells that
this creature can kill you by simply looking at you,
but in truth it is deadly in combat.
The cockatrice is extremely aggressive and fights by
using its huge beak and razor sharp talons.

Page.name: DragonR
Page.text: Dragons are huge majestic creatures. They are extremely
aggressive and even the strongest fighters are not saved
from their attacks. Huge teeth, razor sharp claws and
spear-like tail make this the hardest creature to beat

Page.name: DragonB
Page.text: Dragons are huge majestic creatures. They are extremely
aggressive and even the strongest fighters are not saved
from their attacks. Huge teeth, razor sharp claws and
spear-like tail make this the hardest creature to beat

Page.name: DragonW
Page.text: Dragons are huge majestic creatures. They are extremely
aggressive and even the strongest fighters are not saved
from their attacks. Huge teeth, razor sharp claws and
spear-like tail make this the hardest creature to beat

Page.name: Unicorn
Page.text: A stunningly beautiful white horse, with a single horn

Page.name: Brownie
Page.text: Brownies are a mischievous race with pointy ears that
commonly live in houses or barns. They are very hard
working, though some what high spirited.
Brownies commonly steal food and shiny objects from

Page.name: Wood_Sprite
Page.text: These normally gentle creatures inhabit wooded areas and
are considered the protectors of the trees. It is told
in legends that wood sprites become aggressive when the
trees they protect are chopped down.

Page.name: Imp
Page.text: Imps are often thought of as an aggressive creature.
In actual fact they are just very high spirited and
like to play pranks. Their preferred residence is in
dark caves but they will venture into daylight in
search of friends and people to trick.

Page.name: Leprechaun
Page.text: Leprechauns are tiny people that closely resemble an old
man. They are tricksters and move at a fairly fast speed.
Leprechauns are well known for their treasure and if
you catch one, you might very well find gold.
